article.headline: Georgia 105, Valdosta State 74
article.story: ATHENS, Ga. (AP) -- Takais Brown scored 23 points in his debut to lead Georgia to a 105-74 victory over Valdosta State on Saturday. Brown sat out Georgia's first two games on an academic suspension. The 6-foot-8, 250-pound transfer from Southeastern Illinois College hit 8 of 14 field goals and 7 of 9 free throws. He also had a team-high 7 rebounds for Georgia (2-1). Terrance Woodbury came off the bench to score 17 points for the Bulldogs. Valdosta State (1-1) got 24 points from Devario Hudson and 23 from Mike Crain. The Bulldogs, undersized in recent years, find themselves suddenly awash in big men. Aside from Brown, 6-11 Dave Bliss came off the bench to score 14 points. Albert Jackson, a 6-10 freshman, also grabbed 7 rebounds, and 7-foot starter Rashaad Singleton scored 7. Valdosta State was as close as 21-18 with 8:56 to play in the first half after a mid-range jumper by Hudson. But Georgia reeled off nine straight points, and the Blazers never seriously threatened thereafter.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
